Open Opt-Out Tool Read more on globalprivacycontrol.org Privacy Policy Privacy Policy Print Privacy Policy Effective Date: January 1, 2023 SocialCatfish.com (herein referred to as "Social Catfish," "SocialCatfish.com," or "Social Catfish App") knows that you care about how your personal information is used and shared, and we take your privacy very seriously. Please read the following to learn more about our privacy policy. By visiting our website, utilizing our services, or downloading the Social Catfish App, you are accepting the practices outlined in this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy covers SocialCatfish.com's treatment of personal information that SocialCatfish.com gathers when you are on the SocialCatfish.com website, Social Catfish App, and when you use SocialCatfish.com services. It also addresses the information we collect from third party sources to provide the people search services on our site. If you are a California or Nevada resident, pursuant to the laws of those states, you have additional rights which are fully explained in Social Catfish’s CA and NV Residents Privacy Policy . Please review this additional policy to ensure you fully understand your rights. Information We Collect SocialCatfish.com is an information portal by which individuals may search licensed public data on themselves or third-parties for designated lawful purposes. Search results are provided based solely on licensed data and public internet sources and do not include data collected from consumers on this website. SocialCatfish does not disclose, sell, exchange or transfer the Personal Information you provide on this website except as specifically noted in this Privacy Policy. For a summary of how we use information collected through this website, please see the below list and Section 3 of this Privacy Policy titled Use of Personal Information. To clearly explain how and why your data is collected and used, and in compliance with CCPA, SocialCatfish has created two lists of collected personal information which are found below. The first list shows how data is collected and used through the Social Catfish website. The second list shows how data is collected and used through licensing from third parties and from publicly available sources on the internet. Personal Information Collected through the Website and How We Use it The following section explains the categories of Personal Information collected through the Social Catfish website since January 01, 2022, informing you whether information from those categories has been disclosed or sold to a third-party, and the business purpose for collection, disclosure and/or sale,the categories of service providers processing the information on Social Catfish’s behalf, and the categories of third-parties the information has been sold to or shared with respectively. Identifiers and Personal Information Categories. What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following identifiers from users of our Website: First and last names, email addresses, phone numbers, billing addresses, credit and debit card numbers and IP addresses. What We do With It: We have disclosed this information, but not sold it, since January 01, 2022. This information is collected for purposes of creating accounts and billing for use of our services. It is also used to allow us to provide the services of the website and respond to customer service requests. It is also used for analytics and internal marketing purposes. This information is also used for fraud prevention. This information is disclosed to billing vendors, Social Catfish's marketing services, Social Catfish's third-party analytics services, and Social Catfish's customer service vendor Commercial Information What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following personal information categories from users of our Website: Purchase histories and purchase tendencies (eg. what services a customer has previously used or purchased) regarding use of Social Catfish services. What We do With It: We have disclosed and sold this information  since January 01, 2022. This information is collected, disclosed, and sold for purposes of providing SocialCatfish’s search services to consumers. This information is disclosed to billing vendors, Social Catfish's marketing services, Social Catfish's analytics services, and Social Catfish's customer service vendor Internet or Similar Network Activity What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following personal information categories from related to internet of similar network activity from users of our Website: Analytics using Google analytics, history of searches on the Social Catfish Website including date of search and what was searched, and information on your interaction with the Social Catfish Website including clicks and website use tendencies. What We do With It: We have disclosed this information, but not sold it, since January 01, 2022 This information is collected for purposes of maintaining search histories to ease in the use of our services. It is is also used with our analytics platforms to help improve the service and to be able to improve our internal advertising targeting. This is also used for responding to customer service requests and fraud prevention. This information is disclosed to Social Catfish's marketing services, Social Catfish's analytics services, and Social Catfish's customer service vendor. Equipment Information What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following personal information categories related to equipment information from users of our Website: information about the type of device you use to access the Social Catfish website. What We do With It: We have disclosed this information, but not sold it, since January 01, 2022 This information is collected for analytics purposes, to improve your interaction with the website and for advertising purposes. This information is also used for customer service and fraud prevention. This information is disclosed to Social Catfish's third-party marketing services and Social Catfish's third-party analytics services. Personal Information Social Catfish Collects through Licensing and Publicly Available Sources The following is a chart illustrating the categories of Personal Information collected through licensing from third parties and from publicly available sources on the internet within the last twelve (12) months, addressing whether information from those categories has been disclosed or sold to a third party, and the business purpose for collection, disclosure and/or sale. Identifiers and Personal Information Categories. What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following identifiers through licensing from third parties and publicly available sources on the internet: First and last names, aliases, usernames, profile images, current and past email addresses, current and past home addresses, current and past phone numbers, publicly available education history, potential associates, and publicly available online profiles. What We do With It: We have disclosed and sold this information since January 01, 2022 This information is collected, disclosed, and sold for purposes of providing SocialCatfish’s search services to consumers. This information is disclosed and sold to Consumers using Social Catfish’s services to make searches. Protected Classification Characteristics What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following identifiers through licensing from third parties and publicly available sources on the internet: age, birth date, marital status, languages potentially spoken, and gender. What We do With It: We have disclosed and sold this information since January 01, 2022 This information is collected, disclosed, and sold for purposes of providing SocialCatfish’s search services to consumers. This information is disclosed and sold to Consumers using Social Catfish’s services to make searches. Professional or Employment Related Information What We Collect: Social Catfish collects the following identifiers related to professional or employment related information through licensing from third parties and publicly available sources on the internet: current and previous job history including job title, period worked, industry, employing organization. What We do With It: We have disclosed and sold this information since January 01, 2022 This information is collected, disclosed, and sold for purposes of providing SocialCatfish’s search services to consumers. This information is disclosed and sold to Consumers using Social Catfish’s services to make searches. Note: Personal information does not include: (i) publicly available information, which means: information that is lawfully made available from federal, state, or local government records, or information that a business has a reasonable basis to believe is lawfully made available to the general public by the consumer or from widely distributed media, or by the consumer; or information made available by a person to whom the consumer has disclosed the information if the consumer has not restricted the information to a specific audience; (ii) deidentified or aggregated consumer information; (iii) information excluded from the CCPA's scope, such as health or medical information covered by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) and the California Confidentiality of Medical Information Act (CMIA) or clinical trial data; or (iv) personal information covered by certain sector-specific privacy laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FRCA), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) or California Financial Information Privacy Act (FIPA), and the Driver's Privacy Protection Act of 1994. 2. Sources of Information We obtain the categories of personal information listed above from the following categories of sources: Directly from our clients as part of the registration and transaction process. Indirectly from our clients through website usage details collected automatically. From third-party consumer data resellers and licensors. Information collected from public websites. 3. Use of Personal Information We may use or disclose the personal information we collect for one or more of the following business purposes: To provide you, and other users where stated above in the Information We Collect Section, with information, products or services that you request from us, such as using Social Catfish’s search to find lost connections and verify a person's online identity. To provide, support, personalize, and develop our Website, products, and services. To create, maintain, customize, and secure your account with us. To process your requests, purchases, transactions, and payments and prevent transactional fraud. To help maintain the safety, security, and integrity of our Website, products and services, databases and other technology assets, and business. To respond to law enforcement requests and as required by applicable law, court order, or governmental regulations. To evaluate or conduct a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of our assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which personal information held by SocialCatfish about our Website users is among the assets transferred. 4. Sensitive Information We do not use or disclose any sensitive information on you except to perform services or provide the goods reasonably expected by you, for fraud detection purposes, and to detect security incidents–for example the use of credit card information when you are purchasing services. Sensitive information is defined by the California Privacy Rights Act as information that reveals any of the following: your social security, driver’s license, state identification card, or passport number, your account log-in, financial account, debit card, or credit card number in combination with any required security or access code, password, or credentials allowing access to an account, your precise geolocation; your racial or ethnic origin, religious or philosophical beliefs, or union membership, the contents of your mail, email, and text messages unless the business is the intended recipient of the communication, and your genetic data, biometric information for the purpose of uniquely identifying you, information collected and analyzed concerning your health, and information collected and analyzed concerning your sex life or sexual orientation. 5. Cookies and Passive Information We receive and store certain types of information whenever you interact with us. SocialCatfish.com and its authorized agents automatically receive and record certain "traffic data" on their server logs from your browser including your IP address, SocialCatfish.com cookie information, device information and the page you requested. SocialCatfish.com uses this traffic data to help diagnose problems with its servers, analyze trends and administer the website. Cookies are alphanumeric identifiers that we transfer to your computer's hard drive through your Web browser to enable our systems to recognize your browser and tell us how and when pages in our website are visited and by how many people. SocialCatfish.com cookies do not collect personal information, and we do not combine information collected through cookies with other personal information to tell us who you are or what your screen name or e-mail address is. The "help" portion of the toolbar on the majority of browsers will direct you on how to prevent your browser from accepting new cookies, how to command the browser to tell you when you receive a new cookie, or how to fully disable cookies. We recommend that you leave the cookies activated because cookies allow you to use some of SocialCatfish.com's coolest features. 6. Foreign Users SocialCatfish’s website is hosted in the United States and are governed by United States law. If you are using the website from outside the United States, please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored and processed in the United States. The data protection and other laws of the United States might not be as comprehensive or protective of certain rights as those in your country. Under United States law, your information may be subject to access requests from governments, courts, or law enforcement in the United States. By using the website, you consent to your information being transferred to our facilities and to the facilities of those third parties with whom we share it as described in this Privacy Policy and processed in those facilities. 7. Data Retention and Security Our data retention policies are customized to the type of data, and the purpose for which we use it. In general, for data we collect directly from you, such as when you make an account or purchase our services, we delete, and/or anonymize and aggregate that data three years after you last login to your account, or when you choose to delete your account. An exception to this is when we maintain data for the purpose of security, the prevention of fraud, customer service, or a legal obligation.  In the event we maintain data for one of these excepted uses, it is maintained solely for that purpose. For data collected from licensing or publicly available sources, such as the data you see when you make a search on Social Catfish, it is maintained for one of two possible retention periods.  If a search is made without registering an account, the data is not retained after the search is closed.  If you register an account, your account will keep a copy of the data you searched for until you delete your account, three years have passed since your last login, or the data becomes subject to a deletion request. We have implemented measures designed to secure your personal information from accidental loss and from unauthorized access, use, alteration, and disclosure.he safety and security of your information also depends on you. Where we have given you (or where you have chosen) a password for access to certain parts of our Website, you are responsible for keeping this password confidential. We ask you not to share your password with anyone. Please be aware that, although we endeavor to provide reasonable security for user personal information we process and maintain, no security measures can guarantee absolute safety and prevent all potential security breaches. 8. Fraudulent Requests. Social Catfish takes consumer requests seriously, and endeavors to protect your privacy and comply with your requests.  However, if Social Catfish has a good-faith, reasonable, and documented belief that a consumer request is fraudulent, Social Catfish may deny such a request.  This basis for denial applies to all consumer requests and may be subject to the limitations and requirements of applicable, state privacy laws with which Social Catfish will always comply. Examples of fraudulent requests include, but are not limited to: Impersonating another person. If you make a request, you must do so in your own name, or as an authorized agent of another person.  If you are an authorized agent of another person, you must disclose that fact and provide proof of the consumer’s authorization. Impersonating another person not only violates our Terms of Use, it also is fraud. Obscuring your identity as a consumer making a request. Knowing who is making a request about their information is foundational to the process of completing those requests.  It also is against our Terms of Use for users to disguise the identity or origin of any message sent to Social Catfish.  Examples of this include forging headers, using a virtual private network (VPN) to obscure your IP address, or otherwise obscuring or anonymizing your email or IP address.  Social Catfish is happy to comply with your request but it essential that we know you are a real person and that you are who you claim to be. Using automated means to send multiple unverified requests or requests without proof of authorization. Social Catfish is happy to work with third party authorized agents to process bulk consumer requests and does so successfully with a number of agents.  Using automated means to submit multiple or bulk unverified requests, or requests without any proof of authorization, to Social Catfish is against our Terms of Use , puts a disproportionate load on our systems, and interferes with our processing of legitimate consumer requests. 9. General Opt-Out Requests If you wish to remove your information from the site, please submit an opt out request through our Opt-Out form: https://socialcatfish.com/opt-out/. You will need to verify your email address and submit all URLs with your information. If Social Catfish suspects a fraudulent request, or the request is made by a third-party without any proof of written authorization from the individual the third-party seeks to opt out, Social Catfish may deny the opt-out request. Please note that only pages that contain your information will be removed. You will need to go into each individual URL and submit the URL for removal. Also, note that removing a URL from our site does not remove your information through public record or any other sites. If you wish to make a CCPA or Nevada Opt-Out request, please see the details related to those requests in the relevant sections below. 10. Opt-Out Signals This Website can receive and respect opt-out signals compliant with the Global Privacy Control standard.  You can learn more about Global Privacy Control, and the compatible browsers and applications here: https://globalprivacycontrol.org/ . Please note that as of now, a browser’s opt-out signal can only be correlated with any Personal Information Collected through the Website.  Social Catfish search results are obtained in a manner unrelated to your browser or device, and we cannot automatically link your browser with the data from those databases.  Even if you register an account with Social Catfish, our search results contain records pertaining to multiple people with the same name, which necessitates manual verification and alteration.  If you would like more control over your privacy, you can exercise your opt-out rights per the rest of this policy. 11. Children’s Privacy This Website is only available to users 18 and over. If you are under the age of 18, please do not provide personally identifiable information of any kind whatsoever. 12. No Third Party Rights This Privacy Policy does not create rights enforceable by third parties. 13. Changes SocialCatfish.com may amend this Privacy Policy from time to time, at its sole discretion. Use of information we collect now is subject to the Privacy Policy in effect at the time such information is used. If we make changes to the Privacy Policy, we will notify you by posting an announcement on the SocialCatfish.com website so you are always aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances if any, it is disclosed. For your information, For your information the date this policy was last updated is listed at the top of this page. 14. Contact Us If there are any questions regarding this privacy policy, you may contact us at welcome@socialcatfish.com SUPPLEMENTAL STATE SPECIFIC DISCLOSURES CALIFORNIA DISCLOSURES 1. Your Rights and Choices The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA) provide California residents with specific rights regarding their personal information. This section describes your CCPA, CPRA, and other California specific rights and explains how to exercise those rights. Request to Know A request that a business disclose personal information that it has collected about the consumer the since January 01, 2022 (see details below) Request to Delete A request that a business delete personal information about the consumer. Request to Correct A request that a business correct inaccurate personal information that it maintains about  you. Where Social Catfish believes you will not be negatively impacted by the deletion of the data you wish corrected, we will simply delete the inaccurate data in response to Requests to Correct. Request to Opt-Out A request that a business not sell the consumer’s personal information to third parties. 2. Requests to Know How You may submit a Request to Know through our Request for Access Form or sending an email to CCPARequest@socialcatfish.com . annotations.Text: Our data retention policies are customized to the type of data, and the purpose for which we use it. In general, for data we collect directly from you, such as when you make an account or purchase our services, we delete, and/or anonymize and aggregate that data three years after you last login to your account, or when you choose to delete your account. An exception to this is when we maintain data for the purpose of security, the prevention of fraud, customer service, or a legal obligation. In the event we maintain data for one of these excepted uses, it is maintained solely for that purpose.\n\nFor data collected from licensing or publicly available sources, such as the data you see when you make a search on Social Catfish, it is maintained for one of two possible retention periods. If a search is made without registering an account, the data is not retained after the search is closed. If you register an account, your account will keep a copy of the data you searched for until you delete your account, three years have passed since your last login, or the data becomes subject to a deletion request.
